titles.title: Recognizing the 10th anniversary of the New Transatlantic Agenda, acknowledging the continued importance of the transatlantic partnership between the United States and Europe, and promoting new initiatives to strengthen that partnership.

Recognizing the 10th anniversary of the New Transatlantic Agenda, acknowledging the continued importance of the transatlantic partnership between the United States and Europe, and promoting new initiatives to strengthen that partnership.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Europe and Emerging Threats.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary:
Recognizes: (1) the tenth anniversary of the New Transatlantic Agenda and acknowledges its role in promoting and strengthening the transatlantic partnership; and (2) that the United States and Europe must strengthen and adapt the transatlantic partnership.
Joins with the European Parliament in agreeing to help strengthen the transatlantic partnership by enhancing the dialogue and collaboration between the U.S. Congress and the European Parliament through the framework of the Transatlantic Legislators' Dialogue.
